intro: Saurauia mojandensis, commonly known as the Mojando stonecrop, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and other ericaceous plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
